messageBody:
On 10/13/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
>
> > However, I want to write certain class which is at setUp() method
> to
> > make different testclass sharing the same instaince and passing
> some
> > parameters. Is this possible?
> >
>
> JUnit promotes test isolation.
> Test should not depend on other tests, or on the order they are run.
>
> Passing parameters from one test(case) to another is against JUnit
> nature.


Yes, users asking this question are often pointed to the "Parameterized Test
Case" design pattern, which simulates parameters by putting them in instance
fields and then having test methods use these instance fields.

Bottom line is: parameters are good and useful, and both JUnit 4 and TestNG
support them (but not JUnit 3).

--
